name: ABSINTHE
description: Distilled spirit containing wormwood. Banned in many countries 1900-2000 due to thujone toxicity fears.

name: ACETYLFENTANYL
description: Synthetic opioid 15× stronger than heroin. Linked to 32% of 2016 US opioid deaths.

name: ADRENOCHROME
description: A synthetic compound derived from adrenaline oxidation, historically linked to pseudoscientific claims.

name: AET
description: AET (alpha-ethyltryptamine) is a lesser-known tryptamine with reported psychedelic effects.

name: ALCOHOL
description: Ethanol-based beverages causing sedation, impaired judgment, and motor skill reduction.

name: alpha-PVP

legalStatus.section: Lagen om förbud mot vissa hälsofarliga varor

description: A synthetic cathinone with stimulant properties, often sold as a cheaper alternative to MDMA.

name: AMITRIPTYLINE
description: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) with sedative side effects.

name: AMPHETAMINE
description: A central nervous system stimulant used clinically for ADHD and narcolepsy.

name: AMT
description: Alpha-methyltryptamine (AMT) is a serotonin receptor agonist with reported hallucinogenic effects.

name: AYAHUASCA
description: A traditional Amazonian brew containing DMT and MAO inhibitors.

name: BARBITURATES
description: A class of sedative-hypnotic drugs now largely replaced by benzodiazepines.

name: BK-MBDB
description: Benzylkainyl-MBDB is a synthetic cathinone with empathogenic effects.

name: BROMO-DRAGONFLY
description: A brominated phenethylamine with potent serotonin receptor activation.

name: BUFOTENIN
description: A tryptamine found in Bufo alvarius toad secretions.

name: BZ
description: Benzodiazepine derivatives like quetiapine sometimes abused for sedative effects.

name: BZP
description: Benzylpiperazine (BZP) is a synthetic stimulant with effects similar to amphetamines.

name: CAFFEINE
description: A naturally occurring xanthine alkaloid enhancing alertness and physical performance.

name: CANNABINOIDS
description: Synthetic cannabinoids sprayed onto plant material, mimicking THC effects.

name: CAPSAICIN
description: The active component in chili peppers causing burning sensations.

name: CARBOGEN
description: A mixture of oxygen and carbon dioxide historically used to induce convulsions.

name: CATHINONE
description: A naturally occurring alkaloid in khat leaves.

name: CHLOROFORM
description: A chlorinated hydrocarbon once used as an anesthetic.

name: CHOCOLATE
description: Contains theobromine, a milder stimulant than caffeine.

name: COCAINE / CRACK
description: A central nervous system stimulant derived from coca leaves.

name: DESOMORPHINE
description: A potent opioid synthesized from codeine, often contaminated with toxic chemicals.

name: DET
description: Diethyltryptamine (DET) is a lesser-known tryptamine with reported hallucinogenic effects.

name: DIPT
description: Diisopropyltryptamine (DIPT) is a tryptamine with unique auditory distortion effects.

name: DMT
description: N,N-Dimethyltryptamine is a powerful psychedelic found in plants and animals.

name: DOB
description: 4-Bromo-2,5-dimethoxyphenethylamine (DOB) is a potent serotonin receptor agonist.

name: DOC
description: 2,5-Dimethoxy-4-chloroamphetamine (DOC) is a serotonin receptor agonist with reported hallucinogenic effects.

name: DOI
description: 2,5-Dimethoxy-4-iodoamphetamine (DOI) is a selective 5-HT2A receptor agonist.

name: DOM
description: 2,5-Dimethoxy-4-methylamphetamine (DOM) is a potent serotonin receptor agonist.

name: DPT
description: Dipropyltryptamine (DPT) is a tryptamine with reported empathogenic effects.

name: DXM
description: Dextromethorphan is an antitussive found in cough medicines.

name: EPHEDRINE
description: A naturally occurring alkaloid in Ephedra plants.

name: ETHER
description: Diethyl ether is a volatile anesthetic with rapid induction.

name: ETHYLCATHINONE
description: A synthetic cathinone with effects similar to amphetamines.

name: ETHYLENE
description: A flammable hydrocarbon gas used historically as an anesthetic.

name: ETHYLPHENIDATE
description: A phenethylamine derivative with stimulant properties.

name: GHB
description: Gamma-hydroxybutyrate is a central nervous system depressant.

name: GHV
description: Gamma-hydroxyvaleric acid (GHV) is a GHB analog with similar sedative effects.

name: HARMALA
description: A reversible MAO inhibitor found in Syrian rue.

name: HEROIN
description: A semi-synthetic opioid derived from morphine.

name: HYPocretin
description: Hypocretin-1 and -2 regulate arousal and appetite.

name: IAP
description: N-(1-(2-Iodoethyl)-4-pentylpiperidin-2-yl)-N-methylacetamide is a rare psychedelic amphetamine.

name: IBOGAINE
description: A naturally occurring alkaloid from Tabernanthe iboga.

name: INHALANTS
description: Substances like nitrous oxide and toluene cause rapid intoxication through inhalation.

name: KETAMINE
description: A dissociative anesthetic causing detachment from reality.

name: LSA
description: Lysergic acid amide is a naturally occurring alkaloid in morning glory seeds.

name: LSD
description: Lysergic acid diethylamide is a potent serotonin receptor agonist.

name: LSZ

name: MAOIs
description: Monoamine oxidase inhibitors like phenelzine used for depression.

name: MBDB

name: mCPP

name: MDMA

name: MPTP
